title: Where can I buy an old typewriter? - Quora

response.answer_text: Anywhere really. Garage sales, resale shops, antique stores, the side of the road, the internet...You can get a good machine anywhere from $25 - $1,000, depending on the kind you want. Newer machines from the 60’s on are definitely cheaper, with some from the 70’s only costing $10-20. Machines from the 20’s or 30’s, or the late 1800’s are significantly more expensive, and harder to find working, but operate just as well.If you are confident in your ability to fix anything that could possibly go wrong with a typewriter, than go search eBay. You can find any machine at a wide price range. Broken machines are cheaper, but if you can fix them, then you come out on top.If you don’t know your way around a machine too well, then go find one at a store where you can verify that it works before purchasing it. Test every key, including tab, margain release, and backspace. Check the vibrator, the spool reverse, color change, and all carriage functions. Happy shopping.

If you’re looking for a typewriter to use, and don’t have knowledge enough to restore one, I’d recomend trying to find a site that sells them new. Royal Epochs can be found brand new for about 300 USD.If you happen to live in Arizona, there is a shop called “typewriter exchange,” that sells restored typewriters. If you don’t live near there, online shopping or thrift stores are probably your best bet.Don’t buy the “We are memory keepers Typecast Typewriter.” That machine is junk. Alternatively, you can search eBay and look for reputed sellers who are guaranteeing a working machine.
